Classic.name: Abusive Sergeant
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
Classic.flavor: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!

Classic.name: Angry Chicken
Classic.text: Enrage: +5 Attack.
Classic.flavor: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.

Classic.name: Argent Squire
Classic.text: Divine Shield
Classic.flavor: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath

Classic.name: Bananas
Classic.text: Give a minion +1/+1.

Classic.name: Bestial Wrath
Classic.text: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.
Classic.flavor: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface.  Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

Classic.name: Blessing of Wisdom
Classic.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card.
Classic.flavor: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

Classic.name: Blood Imp
Classic.text: Stealth. At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
Classic.flavor: Imps are content to hide and viciously taunt everyone nearby.

Classic.name: Bloodsail Corsair
Classic.text: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.
Classic.flavor: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers.  It's called the "Pirate's Code".

Classic.name: Cold Blood
Classic.text: Give a minion +2 Attack. Combo: +4 Attack instead.
Classic.flavor: "I'm cold blooded, check it and see!"

Classic.name: Conceal
Classic.text: Give your minions Stealth until your next turn.
Classic.flavor: Rogues conceal everything but their emotions.  You can't get 'em to shut up about feelings.

Classic.name: Dust Devil
Classic.text: Windfury. Overload: (2)
Classic.flavor: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

Classic.name: Earth Shock
Classic.text: Silence a minion, then deal $1 damage to it.
Classic.flavor: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?

Classic.name: Eye for an Eye
Classic.text: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal that much damage to the enemy hero.
Classic.flavor: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

Classic.name: Flame Imp
Classic.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to your hero.
Classic.flavor: Imps like being on fire.  They just do.

Classic.name: Forked Lightning
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage to 2 random enemy minions. Overload: (2)
Classic.flavor: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

Classic.name: Hound
Classic.text: Charge

Classic.name: Hungry Crab
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy a Murloc and gain +2/+2.
Classic.flavor: Murloc.  It's what's for dinner.

Classic.name: Ice Lance
Classic.text: Freeze a character. If it was already Frozen, deal $4 damage instead.
Classic.flavor: The trick is not to break the lance.  Otherwise, you have "Ice Pieces."  Ice Pieces aren't as effective.

Classic.name: Inner Fire
Classic.text: Change a minion's Attack to be equal to its Health.
Classic.flavor: Good idea: Buffing your minions.  Bad idea: Starting a conversation in the Barrens.

Classic.name: Leper Gnome
Classic.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
Classic.flavor: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.

Classic.name: Lightning Bolt
Classic.text: Deal $3 damage. Overload: (1)
Classic.flavor: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

Classic.name: Lightwarden
Classic.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
Classic.flavor: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.

Classic.name: Mana Wyrm
Classic.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack.
Classic.flavor: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

Classic.name: Murloc Tidecaller
Classic.text: Whenever a Murloc is summoned, gain +1 Attack.
Classic.flavor: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

Classic.name: Naturalize
Classic.text: Destroy a minion. Your opponent draws 2 cards.
Classic.flavor: Another one bites the dust.

Classic.name: Noble Sacrifice
Classic.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.
Classic.flavor: We will always remember you, "Defender!"

Classic.name: Power Overwhelming
Classic.text: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 until end of turn. Then, it dies. Horribly.
Classic.flavor: We cannot even describe how horrible the death is.  It's CRAZY bad!  Maybe worse than that.  Just don't do it.

Classic.name: Redemption
Classic.text: Secret: When one of your minions dies, return it to life with 1 Health.
Classic.flavor: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time.  It’s a mystery!

Classic.name: Repentance
Classic.text: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.
Classic.flavor: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

Classic.name: Savagery
Classic.text: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.
Classic.flavor: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

Classic.name: Secretkeeper
Classic.text: Whenever a Secret is played, gain +1/+1.
Classic.flavor: She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.

Classic.name: Shield Slam
Classic.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.
Classic.flavor: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

Classic.name: Shieldbearer
Classic.text: Taunt
Classic.flavor: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.

Classic.name: Southsea Deckhand
Classic.text: Has Charge while you have a weapon equipped.
Classic.flavor: Pirates are into this new fad called "Planking".

Classic.name: Treant
Classic.text: Charge. At the end of the turn, destroy this minion.

Classic.name: Treant
Classic.text: Taunt

Classic.name: Upgrade!
Classic.text: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.
Classic.flavor: Easily worth 50 DKP.

Classic.name: Worgen Infiltrator
Classic.text: Stealth
Classic.flavor: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"

Classic.name: Worthless Imp
Classic.text: You are out of demons! At least there are always imps...

Classic.name: Young Dragonhawk
Classic.text: Windfury
Classic.flavor: They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.

Classic.name: Young Priestess
Classic.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
Classic.flavor: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

Classic.name: Amani Berserker
Classic.text: Enrage: +3 Attack
Classic.flavor: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".

Classic.name: Ancestral Spirit
Classic.text: Give a minion "Deathrattle: Resummon this minion."
Classic.flavor: It was just a flesh wound.

Classic.name: Ancient Watcher
Classic.text: Can't attack.
Classic.flavor: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?

Classic.name: Argent Protector
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Divine Shield.
Classic.flavor: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs.  I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

Classic.name: Armorsmith
Classic.text: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor.
Classic.flavor: She accepts guild funds for repairs!

Classic.name: Battle Rage
Classic.text: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.
Classic.flavor: "You won't like me when I'm angry."

Classic.name: Betrayal
Classic.text: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.
Classic.flavor: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.

Classic.name: Blade Flurry
Classic.text: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemies.
Classic.flavor: "Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast.  It's a lot more complicated than that." - Shan, Rogue Trainer

Classic.name: Bloodmage Thalnos
Classic.text: Spell Damage +1. Deathrattle: Draw a card.
Classic.flavor: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!

Classic.name: Bloodsail Raider
Classic.text: Battlecry: Gain Attack equal to the Attack of your weapon.
Classic.flavor: "I only plunder on days that end in 'y'."

Classic.name: Commanding Shout
Classic.text: Your minions can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn. Draw a card.
Classic.flavor: "Shout! Shout! Let it all out!" - Advice to warriors-in-training

Classic.name: Crazed Alchemist
Classic.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.
Classic.flavor: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.

Classic.name: Cruel Taskmaster
Classic.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
Classic.flavor: "I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday." - Cruel Taskmaster

Classic.name: Defias Ringleader
Classic.text: Combo: Summon a 2/1 Defias Bandit.
Classic.flavor: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

Classic.name: Demonfire
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it’s a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead.
Classic.flavor: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

Classic.name: Dire Wolf Alpha
Classic.text: Adjacent minions have +1 Attack.
Classic.flavor: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

Classic.name: Doomsayer
Classic.text: At the start of your turn, destroy ALL minions.
Classic.flavor: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.

Classic.name: Equality
Classic.text: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1.
Classic.flavor: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

Classic.name: Eviscerate
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage. Combo: Deal $4 damage instead.
Classic.flavor: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent:  It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.

Classic.name: Explosive Trap
Classic.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal $2 damage to all enemies.
Classic.flavor: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

Classic.name: Faerie Dragon
Classic.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
Classic.flavor: Adorable.  Immune to Magic.  Doesn't pee on the rug.  The perfect pet!

Classic.name: Flare
Classic.text: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.
Classic.flavor: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

Classic.name: Freezing Trap
Classic.text: Secret: When an enemy minion attacks, return it to its owner's hand and it costs (2) more.
Classic.flavor: "Dang, that's cold." - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

Classic.name: Gnoll
Classic.text: Taunt

Classic.name: INFERNO!
Classic.text: Hero Power Summon a 6/6 Infernal.

Classic.name: Ironbeak Owl
Classic.text: Battlecry: Silence a minion.
Classic.flavor: Their wings are silent but their screech is... whatever the opposite of silent is.

Classic.name: Knife Juggler
Classic.text: After you summon a minion, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
Classic.flavor: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers.    They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.

Classic.name: Lightwell
Classic.text: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character.
Classic.flavor: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

Classic.name: Loot Hoarder
Classic.text: Deathrattle: Draw a card.
Classic.flavor: Always roll need.

Classic.name: Lorewalker Cho
Classic.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.
Classic.flavor: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.

Classic.name: Mad Bomber
Classic.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.
Classic.flavor: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

Classic.name: Mana Addict
Classic.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.
Classic.flavor: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.

Classic.name: Mana Wraith
Classic.text: ALL minions cost (1) more.
Classic.flavor: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. "Mmmmmm," they say.

Classic.name: Master Swordsmith
Classic.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.
Classic.flavor: He's currently trying to craft a "flail-axe", but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.

Classic.name: Millhouse Manastorm
Classic.text: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (0) next turn.
Classic.flavor: "I'm gonna light you up, sweetcheeks!"

Classic.name: Mind Shatter
Classic.text: Hero Power Deal $3 damage.

Classic.name: Mind Spike
Classic.text: Hero Power Deal $2 damage.

Classic.name: Misdirection
Classic.text: Secret: When a character attacks your hero, instead he attacks another random character.
Classic.flavor: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

Classic.name: Nat Pagle
Classic.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
Classic.flavor: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

Classic.name: Patient Assassin
Classic.text: Stealth. Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
Classic.flavor: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

Classic.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
Classic.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
Classic.flavor: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

Classic.name: Power of the Wild
Classic.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.
Classic.flavor: Never look a panther in the eye.  Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'?  Well, it's one of those.

Classic.name: Rampage
Classic.text: Give a damaged minion +3/+3.
Classic.flavor: Minion get ANGRY.   Minion SMASH!

Classic.name: Scavenging Hyena
Classic.text: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.
Classic.flavor: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.

Classic.name: Slam
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.
Classic.flavor: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

Classic.name: Snake Trap
Classic.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.
Classic.flavor: Why did it have to be snakes?

Classic.name: Snipe
Classic.text: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, deal $4 damage to it.
Classic.flavor: A great sniper hits the spot.  Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

Classic.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
Classic.text: Your spells cost (1) less.
Classic.flavor: Apprentices are great for bossing around.  "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee!  Make that a mana coffee!"

Classic.name: Spirit Wolf
Classic.text: Taunt

Classic.name: Stormforged Axe
Classic.text: Overload: (1)
Classic.flavor: Yo, that's a nice axe.

Classic.name: Sunfury Protector
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Taunt.
Classic.flavor: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

Classic.name: Wild Pyromancer
Classic.text: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
Classic.flavor: BOOM BABY BOOM!  BAD IS GOOD!  DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

Classic.name: Wrath
Classic.text: Choose One - Deal $3 damage to a minion; or $1 damage and draw a card.
Classic.flavor: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

Classic.name: Youthful Brewmaster
Classic.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
Classic.flavor: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!

Classic.name: Ysera Awakens
Classic.text: Deal $5 damage to all characters except Ysera.

Classic.name: Acolyte of Pain
Classic.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card.
Classic.flavor: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.

Classic.name: Alarm-o-Bot
Classic.text: At the start of your turn, swap this minion with a random one in your hand.
Classic.flavor: WARNING.  WARNING.  WARNING.

Classic.name: Aldor Peacekeeper
Classic.text: Battlecry: Change an enemy minion's Attack to 1.
Classic.flavor: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

Classic.name: Arcane Golem
Classic.text: Charge. Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
Classic.flavor: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.

Classic.name: Big Game Hunter
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 7 or more.
Classic.flavor: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him.  Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.

Classic.name: Blood Knight
Classic.text: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.
Classic.flavor: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

Classic.name: Coldlight Oracle
Classic.text: Battlecry: Each player draws 2 cards.
Classic.flavor: They can see the future.   In that future both players draw more cards.   Spoooky.

Classic.name: Coldlight Seer
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give ALL other Murlocs +2 Health.
Classic.flavor: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

Classic.name: Counterspell
Classic.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.
Classic.flavor: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't?  The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

Classic.name: Deadly Shot
Classic.text: Destroy a random enemy minion.
Classic.flavor: Accuracy is not a highly valued trait among the mok'nathal.  Deadliness is near the top, though.

Classic.name: Demolisher
Classic.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
Classic.flavor: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone.  It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

Classic.name: Divine Favor
Classic.text: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent.
Classic.flavor: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!

Classic.name: Eaglehorn Bow
Classic.text: Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability.
Classic.flavor: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

Classic.name: Earthen Ring Farseer
Classic.text: Battlecry: Restore 3 Health.
Classic.flavor: He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.

Classic.name: Edwin VanCleef
Classic.text: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each card played earlier this turn.
Classic.flavor: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

Classic.name: Emperor Cobra
Classic.text: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
Classic.flavor: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.

Classic.name: Far Sight
Classic.text: Draw a card. That card costs (3) less.
Classic.flavor: Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.

Classic.name: Felguard
Classic.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
Classic.flavor: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

Classic.name: Feral Spirit
Classic.text: Summon two 2/3 Spirit Wolves with Taunt. Overload: (2)
Classic.flavor: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

Classic.name: Flesheating Ghoul
Classic.text: Whenever a minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
Classic.flavor: 'Flesheating' is an unfair name.  It's just that there's not really much else for him to eat.

Classic.name: Frothing Berserker
Classic.text: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack.
Classic.flavor: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

Classic.name: Harvest Golem
Classic.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 2/1 Damaged Golem.
Classic.flavor: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."

Classic.name: Headcrack
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.
Classic.flavor: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

Classic.name: Ice Barrier
Classic.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, gain 8 Armor.
Classic.flavor: This is Rank 1.  Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

Classic.name: Ice Block
Classic.text: Secret: When your hero takes fatal damage, prevent it and become Immune this turn.
Classic.flavor: Ice is nice, and will suffice!

Classic.name: Imp Master
Classic.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to this minion and summon a 1/1 Imp.
Classic.flavor: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.

Classic.name: Injured Blademaster
Classic.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to HIMSELF.
Classic.flavor: He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.

Classic.name: Jungle Panther
Classic.text: Stealth
Classic.flavor: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.

Classic.name: King Mukla
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent 2 Bananas.
Classic.flavor: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.

Classic.name: Kirin Tor Mage
Classic.text: Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0).
Classic.flavor: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran.  How do you make a Dalaran float?  Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.

Classic.name: Laughing Sister
Classic.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

Classic.name: Lava Burst
Classic.text: Deal $5 damage. Overload: (2)
Classic.flavor: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

Classic.name: Lightning Storm
Classic.text: Deal $2-$3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (2)
Classic.flavor: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

Classic.name: Mana Tide Totem
Classic.text: At the end of your turn, draw a card.
Classic.flavor: It is said that some shaman can say "Floatin' totem" 10 times, fast.

Classic.name: Mark of Nature
Classic.text: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.
Classic.flavor: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature."  Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

Classic.name: Mind Control Tech
Classic.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take control of one at random.
Classic.flavor: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.

Classic.name: Mirror Entity
Classic.text: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.
Classic.flavor: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

Classic.name: Murloc Warleader
Classic.text: ALL other Murlocs have +2/+1.
Classic.flavor: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

Classic.name: Perdition's Blade
Classic.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage. Combo: Deal 2 instead.
Classic.flavor: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

Classic.name: Questing Adventurer
Classic.text: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.
Classic.flavor: "Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?"

Classic.name: Raging Worgen
Classic.text: Enrage: Windfury and +1 Attack
Classic.flavor: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

Classic.name: Scarlet Crusader
Classic.text: Divine Shield
Classic.flavor: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.

Classic.name: Sense Demons
Classic.text: Put 2 random Demons from your deck into your hand.
Classic.flavor: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

Classic.name: Shadowform
Classic.text: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage'. If already in Shadowform: 3 damage.
Classic.flavor: If a bright light shines on a priest in Shadowform… do they cast a shadow?

Classic.name: SI:7 Agent
Classic.text: Combo: Deal 2 damage.
Classic.flavor: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities.  Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

Classic.name: Southsea Captain
Classic.text: Your other Pirates have +1/+1.
Classic.flavor: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat.  He has hat envy.

Classic.name: Spellbender
Classic.text: Secret: When an enemy casts a spell on a minion, summon a 1/3 as the new target.
Classic.flavor: While it's fun to intercept enemy lightning bolts, a spellbender much prefers to intercept opposing Marks of the Wild.  It just feels meaner.  And blood elves... well, they're a little mean.

Classic.name: Sword of Justice
Classic.text: Whenever you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability.
Classic.flavor: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

Classic.name: Tauren Warrior
Classic.text: Taunt. Enrage: +3 Attack
Classic.flavor: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.

Classic.name: Thoughtsteal
Classic.text: Copy 2 cards from your opponent's deck and put them into your hand.
Classic.flavor: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc?  Nothing!" - Tauren joke

Classic.name: Thrallmar Farseer
Classic.text: Windfury
Classic.flavor: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.

Classic.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
Classic.text: Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.
Classic.flavor: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.

Classic.name: Unbound Elemental
Classic.text: Whenever you play a card with Overload, gain +1/+1.
Classic.flavor: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

Classic.name: Unleash the Hounds
Classic.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.
Classic.flavor: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

Classic.name: Vaporize
Classic.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.
Classic.flavor: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card.  We may never know the truth.

Classic.name: Void Terror
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy the minions on either side of this minion and gain their Attack and Health.
Classic.flavor: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

Classic.name: Ancient Brewmaster
Classic.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
Classic.flavor: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak.  But apparently that's a compliment.

Classic.name: Ancient Mage
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Spell Damage +1.
Classic.flavor: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

Classic.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
Classic.text: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2 weapon.
Classic.flavor: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

Classic.name: Auchenai Soulpriest
Classic.text: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.
Classic.flavor: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

Classic.name: Bite
Classic.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn and 4 Armor.
Classic.flavor: Chew your food!

Classic.name: Cone of Cold
Classic.text: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal $1 damage to them.
Classic.flavor: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.

Classic.name: Cult Master
Classic.text: Whenever one of your other minions dies, draw a card.
Classic.flavor: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

Classic.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
Classic.flavor: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore.  Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.

Classic.name: Defender of Argus
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +1/+1 and Taunt.
Classic.flavor: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.

Classic.name: Dread Corsair
Classic.text: Taunt. Costs (1) less per Attack of your weapon.
Classic.flavor: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

Classic.name: Ethereal Arcanist
Classic.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
Classic.flavor: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

Classic.name: Keeper of the Grove
Classic.text: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Silence a minion.
Classic.flavor: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

Classic.name: Lightspawn
Classic.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.
Classic.flavor: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

Classic.name: Mass Dispel
Classic.text: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card.
Classic.flavor: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.

Classic.name: Master of Disguise
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth.
Classic.flavor: She's actually a male tauren.  People don't call him "Master of Disguise" for nothing.

Classic.name: Mindgames
Classic.text: Put a copy of a random minion from your opponent's deck into the battlefield.
Classic.flavor: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

Classic.name: Mogu'shan Warden
Classic.text: Taunt
Classic.flavor: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!

Classic.name: Mortal Strike
Classic.text: Deal $4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $6 instead.
Classic.flavor: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6

Classic.name: Pit Lord
Classic.text: Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to your hero.
Classic.flavor: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

Classic.name: Shadow Madness
Classic.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.
Classic.flavor: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

Classic.name: Shadowflame
Classic.text: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.
Classic.flavor: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

Classic.name: Silvermoon Guardian
Classic.text: Divine Shield
Classic.flavor: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

Classic.name: Soul of the Forest
Classic.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."
Classic.flavor: "Reforestation" is suddenly a terrifying word.

Classic.name: Spellbreaker
Classic.text: Battlecry: Silence a minion.
Classic.flavor: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders.  The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.

Classic.name: Summoning Portal
Classic.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).
Classic.flavor: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!

Classic.name: Twilight Drake
Classic.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.
Classic.flavor: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy.  And Tacos.

Classic.name: Violet Teacher
Classic.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.
Classic.flavor: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig.  And then you get your name on the board.

Classic.name: Abomination
Classic.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to ALL characters.
Classic.flavor: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

Classic.name: Azure Drake
Classic.text: Spell Damage +1. Battlecry: Draw a card.
Classic.flavor: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.

Classic.name: Bane of Doom
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.
Classic.flavor: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

Classic.name: Blessed Champion
Classic.text: Double a minion's Attack.
Classic.flavor: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

Classic.name: Brawl
Classic.text: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)
Classic.flavor: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

Classic.name: Captain Greenskin
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1/+1.
Classic.flavor: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!

Classic.name: Doomguard
Classic.text: Charge. Battlecry: Discard two random cards.
Classic.flavor: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

Classic.name: Doomhammer
Classic.text: Windfury, Overload: (2)
Classic.flavor: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.

Classic.name: Druid of the Claw
Classic.text: Choose One - Charge; or +2 Health and Taunt.
Classic.flavor: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!

Classic.name: Druid of the Claw
Classic.text: Charge

Classic.name: Druid of the Claw
Classic.text: Taunt

Classic.name: Earth Elemental
Classic.text: Taunt. Overload: (3)
Classic.flavor: Nothing beats rock.

Classic.name: Explosive Shot
Classic.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.
Classic.flavor: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.

Classic.name: Faceless Manipulator
Classic.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
Classic.flavor: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

Classic.name: Fen Creeper
Classic.text: Taunt
Classic.flavor: He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast.   Boom, New Name!

Classic.name: Harrison Jones
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.
Classic.flavor: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”

Classic.name: Holy Wrath
Classic.text: Draw a card and deal damage equal to its cost.
Classic.flavor: C'mon Molten Giant!!

Classic.name: Leeroy Jenkins
Classic.text: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.
Classic.flavor: At least he has Angry Chicken.

Classic.name: Nourish
Classic.text: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.
Classic.flavor: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

Classic.name: Silver Hand Knight
Classic.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/2 Squire.
Classic.flavor: It's good to be a knight.   Less so to be one's squire.

Classic.name: Spiteful Smith
Classic.text: Enrage: Your weapon has +2 Attack.
Classic.flavor: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

Classic.name: Stampeding Kodo
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.
Classic.flavor: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.

Classic.name: Starfall
Classic.text: Choose One - Deal $5 damage to a minion; or $2 damage to all enemy minions.
Classic.flavor: Is the sky falling?  Yes.  Yes it is.

Classic.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
Classic.text: Stealth
Classic.flavor: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

Classic.name: Venture Co. Mercenary
Classic.text: Your minions cost (3) more.
Classic.flavor: No Job is too big.  No fee is too big.

Classic.name: Argent Commander
Classic.text: Charge Divine Shield
Classic.flavor: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.

Classic.name: Avenging Wrath
Classic.text: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.
Classic.flavor: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

Classic.name: Blizzard
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemy minions and Freeze them.
Classic.flavor: This spell can be very Entertaining.

Classic.name: Cabal Shadow Priest
Classic.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.
Classic.flavor: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....

Classic.name: Cairne Bloodhoof
Classic.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/5 Baine Bloodhoof.
Classic.flavor: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.

Classic.name: Force of Nature
Classic.text: Summon three 2/2 Treants with Charge that die at the end of the turn.
Classic.flavor: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

Classic.name: Frost Elemental
Classic.text: Battlecry: Freeze a character.
Classic.flavor: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

Classic.name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
Classic.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.
Classic.flavor: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.

Classic.name: Hogger
Classic.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
Classic.flavor: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.

Classic.name: Holy Fire
Classic.text: Deal $5 damage. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
Classic.flavor: Often followed by Holy Smokes!

Classic.name: Illidan Stormrage
Classic.text: Whenever you play a card, summon a 2/1 Flame of Azzinoth.
Classic.flavor: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years.  Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

Classic.name: Kidnapper
Classic.text: Combo: Return a minion to its owner's hand.
Classic.flavor: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

Classic.name: Priestess of Elune
Classic.text: Battlecry: Restore 4 Health to your hero.
Classic.flavor: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

Classic.name: Savannah Highmane
Classic.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Hyenas.
Classic.flavor: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

Classic.name: Siphon Soul
Classic.text: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to your hero.
Classic.flavor: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

Classic.name: Sunwalker
Classic.text: Taunt Divine Shield
Classic.flavor: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!

Classic.name: Sylvanas Windrunner
Classic.text: Deathrattle: Take control of a random enemy minion.
Classic.flavor: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.

Classic.name: Temple Enforcer
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +3 Health.
Classic.flavor: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

Classic.name: The Beast
Classic.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.
Classic.flavor: He lives in Blackrock Mountain.  He eats Gnomes.  That's pretty much it.

Classic.name: The Black Knight
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy an enemy minion with Taunt.
Classic.flavor: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament.   We can pretty much mark that a failure.

Classic.name: Windfury Harpy
Classic.text: Windfury
Classic.flavor: Harpies are not pleasant sounding.  That's the nicest I can put it.

Classic.name: Ancient of Lore
Classic.text: Choose One - Draw 2 cards; or Restore 5 Health.
Classic.flavor: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.

Classic.name: Ancient of War
Classic.text: Choose One - +5 Attack; or +5 Health and Taunt.
Classic.flavor: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.

Classic.name: Archmage Antonidas
Classic.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to your hand.
Classic.flavor: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

Classic.name: Baron Geddon
Classic.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.
Classic.flavor: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

Classic.name: Gladiator's Longbow
Classic.text: Your hero is Immune while attacking.
Classic.flavor: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

Classic.name: Gorehowl
Classic.text: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.
Classic.flavor: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!

Classic.name: Prophet Velen
Classic.text: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.
Classic.flavor: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

Classic.name: Ravenholdt Assassin
Classic.text: Stealth
Classic.flavor: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold.  He'll take care of the rest.

Classic.name: Al'Akir the Windlord
Classic.text: Windfury, Charge, Divine Shield, Taunt
Classic.flavor: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords.  And the other three don't let him forget it.

Classic.name: Grommash Hellscream
Classic.text: Charge Enrage: +6 Attack
Classic.flavor: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.

Classic.name: Gruul
Classic.text: At the end of each turn, gain +1/+1 .
Classic.flavor: He's Gruul "the Dragonkiller".  He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…

Classic.name: Lay on Hands
Classic.text: Restore #8 Health. Draw 3 cards.
Classic.flavor: A grammatically awkward life saver.

Classic.name: Ragnaros the Firelord
Classic.text: Can't attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.
Classic.flavor: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord.  Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.

Classic.name: Tirion Fordring
Classic.text: Divine Shield. Taunt. Deathrattle: Equip a 5/3 Ashbringer.
Classic.flavor: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

Classic.name: Twisting Nether
Classic.text: Destroy all minions.
Classic.flavor: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

Classic.name: Alexstrasza
Classic.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.
Classic.flavor: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.

Classic.name: Cenarius
Classic.text: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.
Classic.flavor: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.

Classic.name: King Krush
Classic.text: Charge
Classic.flavor: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

Classic.name: Lord Jaraxxus
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.
Classic.flavor: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

Classic.name: Malygos
Classic.text: Spell Damage +5
Classic.flavor: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!

Classic.name: Nozdormu
Classic.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.
Classic.flavor: Time to write some flavor text.

Classic.name: Onyxia
Classic.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.
Classic.flavor: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

Classic.name: Ysera
Classic.text: At the end of your turn, add a Dream Card to your hand.
Classic.flavor: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream.  Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?

Classic.name: Deathwing
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand.
Classic.flavor: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated.  Daddy issues?

Classic.name: Pyroblast
Classic.text: Deal $10 damage.
Classic.flavor: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

Classic.name: Sea Giant
Classic.text: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.
Classic.flavor: See?  Giant.

Classic.name: Mountain Giant
Classic.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.
Classic.flavor: His mother said that he was just big boned.

Classic.name: Molten Giant
Classic.text: Costs (1) less for each damage your hero has taken.
Classic.flavor: He gets terrible heartburn.  BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.

Basic.text: This Beast has +1 Attack from Timber Wolf.

Basic.text: Going second grants you increased Health.

Basic.name: Rockbiter Weapon
Basic.text: This character has +3 Attack this turn.

Basic.name: The Coin
Basic.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only.

Basic.name: Ancestral Healing
Basic.text: Restore a minion to full Health and give it Taunt.
Basic.flavor: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.

Basic.name: Avatar of the Coin
Basic.text: You lost the coin flip, but gained a friend.

Basic.name: Backstab
Basic.text: Deal $2 damage to an undamaged minion.
Basic.flavor: It's funny how often yelling "Look over there!" gets your opponent to turn around.

Basic.name: Excess Mana
Basic.text: Draw a card. (You can only have 10 Mana in your tray.)

Basic.name: Hunter's Mark
Basic.flavor: Never play 'Hide and Go Seek' with a Hunter.

Basic.name: Innervate
Basic.text: Gain 2 Mana Crystals this turn only.
Basic.flavor: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

Basic.name: Moonfire
Basic.flavor: "Cast Moonfire, and never stop." - How to Be a Druid, Chapter 5, Section 3

Basic.name: Sacrificial Pact
Basic.text: Destroy a Demon. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
Basic.flavor: This is the reason that Demons never really become friends with Warlocks.

Basic.name: Totemic Might
Basic.flavor: Totem-stomping is no longer recommended.

Basic.name: Arcane Missiles
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage randomly split among all enemies.
Basic.flavor: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.

Basic.name: Arcane Shot
Basic.flavor: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves.  The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.

Basic.name: Blessing of Might
Basic.flavor: "As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way." - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.

Basic.name: Claw
Basic.text: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn and 2 Armor.
Basic.flavor: The claw decides who will stay and who will go.

Basic.name: Corruption
Basic.text: Choose an enemy minion. At the start of your turn, destroy it.
Basic.flavor: It starts with stealing a pen from work, and before you know it, BOOM!  Corrupted!

Basic.name: Deadly Poison
Basic.flavor: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells.  Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison?  Poison Elemental?  Nobody wants that.

Basic.name: Elven Archer
Basic.flavor: Don't bother asking her out on a date.  She'll shoot you down.

Basic.name: Execute
Basic.flavor: It's okay, he deserved it.

Basic.name: Frost Shock
Basic.text: Deal $1 damage to an enemy character and Freeze it.
Basic.flavor: FROST SHOCK!

Basic.name: Goldshire Footman
Basic.flavor: If 1/2 minions are all that is defending Goldshire, you would think it would have been overrun years ago.

Basic.name: Grimscale Oracle
Basic.flavor: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.

Basic.name: Hand of Protection
Basic.flavor: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.

Basic.name: Healing Totem
Basic.text: At the end of your turn, restore 1 Health to all friendly minions.

Basic.name: Holy Smite
Basic.flavor: It doesn't matter how pious you are.  Everyone needs a good smiting now and again.

Basic.name: Humility
Basic.flavor: This card makes something really damp.  Oh wait.  That's "Humidity."

Basic.name: Light's Justice
Basic.flavor: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.

Basic.name: Mind Vision
Basic.text: Put a copy of a random card in your opponent's hand into your hand.
Basic.flavor: I see what you did there.

Basic.name: Mirror Image
Basic.flavor: Oh hey it's Mirror Image! !egamI rorriM s'ti yeh hO

Basic.name: Mortal Coil
Basic.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.
Basic.flavor: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

Basic.name: Murloc Raider
Basic.flavor: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!

Basic.name: Northshire Cleric
Basic.text: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.
Basic.flavor: They help the downtrodden and distressed.  Also they sell cookies.

Basic.name: Power Word: Shield
Basic.text:
Give a minion +2 Health.
Draw a card.
Basic.flavor: Sure the extra protection is nice, but the shield really reduces visibility.

Basic.name: Rockbiter Weapon
Basic.text: Give a friendly character +3 Attack this turn.
Basic.flavor: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.

Basic.name: Sinister Strike
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage to the enemy hero.
Basic.flavor: There's something about this strike that just feels off.  Sinister, even.

Basic.name: Soulfire
Basic.text: Deal $4 damage. Discard a random card.
Basic.flavor: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

Basic.name: Stonetusk Boar
Basic.flavor: This card is boaring.

Basic.name: Timber Wolf
Basic.flavor: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.

Basic.name: Tracking
Basic.text: Look at the top three cards of your deck. Draw one and discard the others.
Basic.flavor: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!

Basic.name: Voidwalker
Basic.flavor: No relation to "The Voidsteppers", the popular Void-based dance troupe.

Basic.name: Voodoo Doctor
Basic.flavor: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

Basic.name: Whirlwind
Basic.flavor: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

Basic.name: Acidic Swamp Ooze
Basic.flavor: Oozes love Flamenco.  Don't ask.

Basic.name: Arcane Explosion
Basic.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions.
Basic.flavor: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.

Basic.name: Bloodfen Raptor
Basic.flavor: "Kill 30 raptors." - Hemet Nesingwary

Basic.name: Bluegill Warrior
Basic.flavor: He just wants a hug.   A sloppy... slimy... hug.

Basic.name: Cleave
Basic.text: Deal $2 damage to two random enemy minions.
Basic.flavor: Hey you two…could you stand next to each other for a second…

Basic.name: Divine Spirit
Basic.flavor: Double the trouble. Double the fun!

Basic.name: Fiery War Axe
Basic.flavor: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.
Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems.  There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.
Basic.name: Flametongue Totem
Frostbolt
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage to a character and Freeze it.
Basic.flavor: It is customary to yell "Chill out!" or "Freeze!" or "Ice ice, baby!" when you play this card.

Basic.name: Frostwolf Grunt
Basic.flavor: Grunting is what his father did and his father before that.   It's more than just a job.

Basic.name: Heroic Strike
Basic.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn.
Basic.flavor: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.

Basic.name: Holy Light
Basic.flavor: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.

Basic.name: Kobold Geomancer
Basic.flavor: In the old days, Kobolds were the finest candle merchants in the land. Then they got pushed too far...

Basic.name: Life Tap
Basic.text: Hero Power Draw a card and take $2 damage.

Basic.name: Mark of the Wild
Basic.text: Give a minion Taunt and +2/+2. (+2 Attack/+2 Health)
Basic.flavor: Not to be confused with Jim of the Wild.

Basic.name: Mind Blast
Basic.text: Deal $5 damage to the enemy hero.
Basic.flavor: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.

Basic.name: Murloc Tidehunter
Basic.flavor: "Death will rise, from the tides!"

Basic.name: NOOOOOOOOOOOO
Basic.text: Somehow, the card you USED to have has been deleted.  Here, have this one instead!
Basic.flavor: Even your flavor text has been deleted. Dang.

Basic.name: Novice Engineer
Basic.flavor: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

Basic.name: Reinforce
Basic.text: Hero Power Summon a 1/1 Silver Hand Recruit.

Basic.name: River Crocolisk
Basic.flavor: Edward "Lefty" Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.

Basic.name: Sap
Basic.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.
Basic.flavor: Rogues love sappy movies.

Basic.name: Shadow Word: Pain
Basic.text: Destroy a minion with 3 or less Attack.
Basic.flavor: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: "Shadow Word: Annoy".

Basic.name: Shiv
Basic.flavor: Rogues are experts at SHIV-al-ry.

Basic.name: Steady Shot
Basic.text: Hero Power Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero.

Basic.name: Succubus
Basic.flavor: Warlocks have it pretty good.

Basic.name: Wild Growth
Basic.flavor: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!

Basic.name: Windfury
Basic.flavor: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

Basic.name: Animal Companion
Basic.flavor: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer!  Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.

Basic.name: Arcane Intellect
Basic.flavor: Playing this card makes you SMARTER.  And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.

Basic.name: Charge
Basic.text: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack and Charge.
Basic.flavor: "Guys! Guys! Slow down!" - some kind of non-warrior minion

Basic.name: Dalaran Mage
Basic.flavor: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

Basic.name: Drain Life
Basic.text: Deal $2 damage. Restore #2 Health to your hero.
Basic.flavor: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."

Basic.name: Fan of Knives
Basic.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw a card.
Basic.flavor: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

Basic.name: Frost Nova
Basic.flavor: Hey man, that's cold.  Literally and metaphorically.

Basic.name: Healing Touch
Basic.flavor: 8 Health, no waiting.

Basic.name: Hex
Basic.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.
Basic.flavor: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

Basic.name: Ironforge Rifleman
Basic.flavor: "Ready! Aim! Drink!"

Basic.name: Ironfur Grizzly
Basic.flavor: "Bear Carcass 1/10"

Basic.name: Kill Command
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage. If you have a Beast, deal $5 damage instead.
Basic.flavor: "Kill!", he commanded.

Basic.name: Magma Rager
Basic.flavor: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.

Basic.name: Raid Leader
Basic.flavor: "That's a 50 DKP minus!"

Basic.name: Razorfen Hunter
Basic.flavor: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once.  ONCE.

Basic.name: Savage Roar
Basic.text: Give your characters +2 Attack this turn.
Basic.flavor: What do they roar? Nobody can quite tell, but it sounds like "Elephant Macho Breeze".  It's probably not that, though.

Basic.name: Shadow Bolt
Basic.flavor: It’s a Bolt.   Its made out of Shadow.   What more do you need to know!

Basic.name: Shadow Word: Death
Basic.text: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 5 or more.
Basic.flavor: If you miss, it leaves a lightning-bolt-shaped scar on your target.

Basic.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
Basic.flavor: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!

Basic.name: Shield Block
Basic.flavor: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

Basic.name: Silverback Patriarch
Basic.flavor: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.

Basic.name: Warsong Commander
Basic.flavor: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.

Basic.name: Wolfrider
Basic.flavor: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.

Basic.name: Blessing of Kings
Basic.flavor: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?

Basic.name: Chillwind Yeti
Basic.flavor: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

Basic.name: Consecration
Basic.flavor: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy.  But it smells a little, too.

Basic.name: Dragonling Mechanic
Basic.flavor: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

Basic.name: Fireball
Basic.flavor: This spell is useful for burning things.  If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.

Basic.name: Gnomish Inventor
Basic.flavor: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!

Basic.name: Hammer of Wrath
Basic.flavor: A good paladin has many tools.  Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.

Basic.name: Hellfire
Basic.flavor: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.

Basic.name: Houndmaster
Basic.flavor: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks.  It's rhetorical.

Basic.name: Kor'kron Elite
Basic.flavor: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.

Basic.name: Multi-Shot
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage to two random enemy minions.
Basic.flavor: You see, it's all about throughput.

Basic.name: Oasis Snapjaw
Basic.flavor: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.

Basic.name: Ogre Magi
Basic.flavor: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

Basic.name: Polymorph
Basic.text: Transform a minion into a 1/1 Sheep.
Basic.flavor: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.

Basic.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
Basic.flavor: Sen'jin Villiage is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

Basic.name: Stormwind Knight
Basic.flavor: They're still embarassed about "The Deathwing Incident".

Basic.name: Swipe
Basic.text: Deal $4 damage to an enemy and $1 damage to all other enemies.
Basic.flavor: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe!  ... or hug.

Basic.name: Truesilver Champion
Basic.text: Whenever your hero attacks, restore 2 Health to it.
Basic.flavor: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)

Basic.name: Water Elemental
Basic.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
Basic.flavor: Don't summon a water elemental at a party.  It'll dampen the mood.

Basic.name: Windspeaker
Basic.flavor: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

Basic.name: Arcanite Reaper
Basic.flavor: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.

Basic.name: Assassin's Blade
Basic.flavor: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin.   Certificate of authenticity included.

Basic.name: Assassinate
Basic.flavor: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!

Basic.name: Bloodlust
Basic.text: Give your minions +3 Attack this turn.
Basic.flavor: blaarghghLLGHRHARAAHAHHH!!

Basic.name: Booty Bay Bodyguard
Basic.flavor: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.

Basic.name: Darkscale Healer
Basic.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.
Basic.flavor: Healing is just something she does in her free time.  It's more of a hobby really.

Basic.name: Frostwolf Warlord
Basic.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.
Basic.flavor: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley.  Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

Basic.name: Gurubashi Berserker
Basic.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3 Attack.
Basic.flavor: No Pain, No Gain.

Basic.name: Holy Nova
Basic.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemies. Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.
Basic.flavor: If the Holy Light forsakes you, good luck casting this spell.  Also, you're probably a jerk.

Basic.name: Nightblade
Basic.flavor: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

Basic.name: Starving Buzzard
Basic.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.
Basic.flavor: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

Basic.name: Stormpike Commando
Basic.flavor: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts.  They also bake a mean cupcake.

Basic.name: Tundra Rhino
Basic.flavor: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos.  Or am I mistaken?

Basic.name: Archmage
Basic.flavor: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.

Basic.name: Boulderfist Ogre
Basic.flavor: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

Basic.name: Dread Infernal

Basic.flavor: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion

Basic.name: Fire Elemental
Basic.flavor: He can never take a bath. Ewww.

Basic.name: Lord of the Arena
Basic.flavor: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.

Basic.name: Reckless Rocketeer
Basic.flavor: One Insane Rocketeer.   One Rocket full of Explosives.   Infinite Fun.

Basic.name: Starfire
Basic.flavor: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.

Basic.name: Vanish
Basic.text: Return all minions to their owner's hand.

Basic.name: Core Hound
Basic.flavor: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

Basic.name: Flamestrike
Basic.text: Deal $4 damage to all enemy minions.
Basic.flavor: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.

Basic.name: Guardian of Kings
Basic.flavor: Holy beings from the beyond are so cliché!

Basic.name: Sprint
Basic.flavor: Rogues are not good joggers.

Basic.name: Stormwind Champion
Basic.flavor: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

Basic.name: War Golem
Basic.flavor: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them.  Instinct, maybe?  A desire to blend in?

Basic.name: Ironbark Protector
Basic.flavor: I dare you to attack Darnassus.

Basic.name: Mind Control
Basic.text: Take control of an enemy minion.
Basic.flavor: Nominated as "Spell Most Likely to Make Your Opponent Punch the Wall."

Promotion.name: Transformed

Promotion.name: Emboldener 3000
Promotion.text: At the end of your turn, give a random minion +1/+1.

Promotion.name: Homing Chicken
Promotion.text: At the start of your turn, destroy this minion and draw 3 cards.

Promotion.name: Poultryizer
Promotion.text: At the start of your turn, transform a random minion into a 1/1 Chicken.

Promotion.name: Repair Bot
Promotion.text: At the end of your turn, restore 6 Health to a damaged character.

Promotion.name: I Am Murloc
Promotion.text: Summon three, four, or five 1/1 Murlocs.

Promotion.name: Elite Tauren Chieftain
Promotion.text: Battlecry: Give both players the power to ROCK! (with a Power Chord card)
Promotion.flavor: He's looking for a drummer.  The current candidates are: Novice Engineer, Sen'jin Shieldmasta', and Ragnaros the Firelord.

Promotion.name: Gelbin Mekkatorque
Promotion.flavor: He's the leader of the gnomes, and an incredible inventor.  He's getting better, too; He turns things into chickens WAY less than he used to.
Promotion.howToGetGold: This was rewarded to players who helped test the Store during the Beta.

Reward.name: Captain's Parrot
Reward.text: Battlecry: Put a random Pirate from your deck into your hand.
Reward.flavor: Pirates and Parrots go together like Virmen and Carrots.
Reward.howToGet: Unlocked when you have all the Pirates from the Classic Set.
Reward.howToGetGold: Unlocked when you have all the Golden Pirates from the Classic Set.

Reward.text: Charge. Has +1 Attack for each other Murloc on the battlefield.
Reward.howToGet: Unlocked when you have all the Murlocs from the Classic Set.
Reward.flavor: He's a legend among murlocs.  "Mrghllghghllghg!", they say.
Reward.howToGetGold: Unlocked when you have all the Golden Murlocs from the Classic and Basic Sets.
